derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Latin from Greek sandalion, diminutive of sandalon 'wooden shoe', probably of Asiatic origin; compare with Persian sandal

encyclopedia.content: sandal 名词 n. [C] 1. 凉鞋 Many people wear sandals in the summer. 夏天许多人穿凉鞋。 2. 拖鞋 3. 锛埞糯＠奥蘼砣舜┑娘級带子鞋 4. 鞋襻 sandal 名词 n. 1. 【植】檀香，白檀[C] 2. 檀香木，白檀木[U]

entry.def: Sandals are light shoes that you wear in warm weather, which have straps instead of a solid part over the top of your foot.

means.word_mean: 1. a shoe consisting of a sole fastened by straps to the foot
